revision.text:
An '''End-user certificate''', or '''EUC''', is a document used in international transfers, including sales and arms provided as aid, of [[weapons]] and [[ammunition]] to certify that the buyer is the final recipient of the materials, and is not planning on transferring the materials to another party. EUCs are required by many governments to restrict the flow of the materials to undesired destinations, such as [[embargo]]ed states or rebel groups, governments with bad human rights records or states which are considered a threat by the original supplier of the arms.
There are several problems with EUCs as a means to prevent undesirable [[arms exports]]. EUCs can be [[forgery|forged]] or falsified; they can also be obtained from [[corrupt]] officials, therefore there is a need for EUCs that are difficult to forge.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://books.sipri.org/files/insight/SIPRIInsight1003.pdf |title=End-User Certificates: Improving standards to prevent diversion |accessdate=2010-09-05}}</ref> Another problem is that an EUC does not guarantee that the arms recipient will actually live up to its promise not to re-transfer the weapons received. EUCs which are not backed up by proper end-use monitoring are weak.
In 1936-1938, German arms were supplied to both sides in the [[Spanish Civil War]] via Greece using Greek then Mexican end-user certificates, see [[Pyrkal]]. ==References== <references />
[[Category:Arms control]] [[Category:Military industry]] [[Category:Weapons trade]]

{{refimprove|date=December 2013}} {{Infobox Officeholder |name=Felipe Llavallol |image= Felipellavallol.png |imagesize=180px |office=[[Governor of Buenos Aires|Governor]] of the [[State of Buenos Aires]] |term= October 23, 1859 — May 3, 1860 |predecessor=[[Valentín Alsina]] |successor=[[Bartolomé Mitre]] |birth_date= December 26, 1802 |birth_place=[[Buenos Aires]], [[Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata]] |death_date= {{death date and age|1874|4|4|1802|12|26|}} |death_place= [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]] |party=[[Unitarian Party]] |spouse= Martina Monasterio<ref name=alcurnia>{{cite web|url=http://www.genealogiafamiliar.net/getperson.php?personID=I5841&tree=BVCZ |title=Genealogía familiar: Felipe Llavallol|language=es}}</ref> |occupation= Merchant }} '''Felipe Esteban Llavallol''' (December 26, 1802 — April 4, 1874) was an Argentine merchant, philanthropist, lawmaker and briefly Governor of the secessionist [[State of Buenos Aires]].
==Life and times== Llavallol was born in [[Buenos Aires]] to María Gertrudis de Merlo and Jaime Llavallol; the elder Llavallol was a [[Catalan people|Catalan]] merchant from [[Barcelona]] who had emigrated to [[Buenos Aires]] in the 1790s, and Felipe Llavallol joined his father in business. He married the former Martina Monasterio in 1833, and they had seven children. He inherited his father's [[commerce|commercial]] establishment in 1838 and became one of Buenos Aires' leading businesspeople.
Following the September 11, 1852, declaration of the secessionist [[State of Buenos Aires]], Llavallol held numerous posts in the new government. He was elected to the Lower House of Congress, becoming President of the Chamber, and to the Senate in 1854, serving as its president until 1856. He was appointed Economy Minister and took part in the establishment of the [[Buenos Aires Stock Exchange]] in 1854, and served as its first president until August 1855. Named President of the newly established [[Buenos Aires Western Railway]], he presided over the August 30, 1857, inaugural of its first line, designed by British engineer [[William Bragge]].
Elected Vice-Governor in [[Valentín Alsina]]'s ticket in December 1858, the defeat of Buenos Aires forces by those of the [[Argentine Confederation]] at the [[Battle of Cepeda (1859)]] led to Confederate President [[Justo José de Urquiza]]'s demand that Alsina resign, and the more pragmatic Llavallol succeeded Alsina as governor on October 23, 1859.
Governor Llavallol's brief tenure as governor was highlighted by the resulting negotiations, which produced the [[Pact of San José de Flores]] and significant concessions toward Buenos Aires. He stepped down on May 3, 1860, upon the legislature's election of Colonel [[Bartolomé Mitre]], who defeated Confederate forces at the 1861 [[Battle of Pavón]] and reincorporated Buenos Aires into a unified [[Argentina]].
Llavallol continued his work as a member of the ''Comisión Filantrópica'' [[charity organization]], and died in Buenos Aires in 1874, at age 71. He was interred in [[La Recoleta Cemetery]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.genealogiafamiliar.net/showmedia.php?mediaID=976&medialinkID=3642|title= Genealogía familiar: Mausoleo familiar Llavallol|language=es}}</ref>
==References== *Levene, Ricardo. ''A History of Argentina''. University of North Carolina Press, 1937. *''Historical Dictionary of Argentina''. London:Scarecrow Press, 1978. {{reflist}}

'''Fernand Hautain''' (1858–1942) was a [[Belgium|Belgian]] businessman and governor of the [[National Bank of Belgium]] (NBB) from 1923 until 1926.
==Career== He started his career at an early age, and combined working with evening classes and self-tuition. He started working for the NBB at the age of 19, as a bank clerk in the bank's branch in his home town of [[Nivelles]] and three years went on to work as a clerk at the Brussels head office. In 1901, Fernand Hautain was appointed an agent in [[Philippeville]] and then in [[La Louvière]], where in 1907 he became the manager of the discount office. As a businessman, he became commissioner for a several industrial limited companies. When [[World War I]] broke out, he was appointed as a director of the Bank and after the war, in 1923, he succeeded [[Leon Van der Rest]] as governor of the NBB.
During his term as governor, the Belgian government tried to deal with the postwar monetary crisis and to stabilise the [[belgian franc]]. In 1926, [[Emile Francqui]], as minister Minister without Portfolio was the architect of the reform plan which would solve the monetary crisis. The bad relationship between Emile Francqui and Fernand Hautain would lead to the dismissal of Fernand Hautain from office. He was succeeded by [[Louis Franck (politician)|Louis Franck]].
After his dismissal, Hautain returned to the business world, and he remained deputy administrator of the ''Société Nationale de Crédit à l'Industrie'', which he had helped to establish in 1919.
==Sources== * P. Kauch, ''Fernand Hautain, neuvième Gouverneur de la Banque Nationale de Belgique'' (1868-1942), Bruxelles, BNB, 1960 * [http://www.nbb.be/pub/01_00_00_00_00/01_02_00_00_00/01_02_02_00_00/01_02_02_09_00.htm?l=en&t=bu Fernand Hautain]

{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2015}} {{BLP sources|date=June 2012}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Harry Gschoesser | image = | image_size = 250 | landscape = | caption = | background = non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1961|07|25|mf=y}} | instrument = Drums | genre = Rock, [[hard rock]], [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]], [[Fusion (music)|fusion]] | occupation = Musician, entrepreneur | associated_acts = [[Racer X (band)|Racer X]], No Bros, Speedy Weekend, Icebreaker }}
'''Harald "Harry" Gschoesser''' (born July 25, 1961) is an Austrian entrepreneur and musician. He is the founder of the social network for musicians, Speedgig.<ref>{{cite web|title=Speedgig |url=http://www.speedgig.com/about | accessdate=June 10, 2012}}</ref> He is also a former band drummer of [[Racer X (band)|Racer X]],<ref name="Racer X band Info">{{cite web | url=http://racerxband.com/band.htm | title=Racer X band Info | accessdate=June 10, 2012}}</ref> which is an American heavy metal band based out of Los Angeles, and former drummer of Austrian rock bands No Bros and Speedy Weekend Band.
==Early life== Gschoesser was born in Tirol, Austria. He started playing the drums at the late age of 17. He first attracted the attention of the Austrian band, Scream, with Andy Woerz, who later became an Austrian actor and singer. In 1981, Gschoesser started drumming for the Speedy Weekend Band, which became the most popular heavy metal band in Austria at that time.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sra.at/band/1113 | title=Speedy Weekend Band Info | accessdate=June 10, 2012}}</ref> Playing all over Austria, they also opened for [[Eric Burdon]], [[Roger Chapman]], and others during their Austrian tour.
==History with No Bros== After the Speedy Weekend Band broke up, Gschoesser was picked up by No Bros in 1983, an Austrian rock band. Managed by Gotthard Rieger, the band started recording later that year and released the album ''Our Own Way''.<ref>{{cite web|title=No Bros History|url=http://www.nobros.com/history.htm|accessdate=June 10, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131021054824/http://nobros.com/history.htm|archivedate=October 21, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> In subsequent years, No Bros went on European tours with other bands such as [[Saxon (band)|Saxon]], [[Samson (band)|Samson]], Girlschool, and [[Ginger Baker]] and Band, who was the former drummer of [[Cream (band)|Cream]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ginger-baker.eu/ |title=The Ginger Baker Site |publisher=Ginger-baker.eu |date= |accessdate=2014-07-18}}</ref>
==Racer X== In 1985, Gschoesser moved to Los Angeles and enrolled at the [[Musicians Institute]], where he met fellow students and future Racer X bandmates [[Paul Gilbert]] and [[Juan Alderete]]. Later that year, Paul Gilbert, who later helped form the popular band [[Mr. Big (band)|Mr. Big]], asked Gschoesser to be his drummer for [[Racer X (band)|Racer X]]. Soon after, Juan Alderete, came on as the bass player and later Jeff Martin as their singer.<ref name="Racer X band Info"/> Gilbert entered in a Guitar competition, Guitar Wars, with Gschoesser and Alderete at Gazzarries on the Sunset Strip. Racer X won the competition.<ref name="popularity">{{cite web | url=http://www.ugo.com/channels/music/features/bandsondemand/artist.aspx?artist=racerx&cat=metal&full=Racer%20X | title=Racer X Gains Popularity | accessdate=August 3, 2010 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110615033950/http://www.ugo.com/channels/music/features/bandsondemand/artist.aspx?artist=racerx&cat=metal&full=Racer%20X | archivedate=June 15, 2011 | df=mdy-all }}</ref>
The band started their recording process at Sun Parrier studio near San Francisco in 1985.<ref name="Racer X band Info"/> Since Gschoesser was only on a student visa, he was not allowed to record. The band received legal permission for Gschoesser to work for 24 hours. This allowed Gschoesser to record his drum sequence, while the rest of the band finished up the record in two weeks. After, Racer X released its debut album ''[[Street Lethal]]'' on January 1, 1986 on Mike Varney's [[Shrapnel Records]] label.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.shrapnelrecords.com/servlet/store?item=catalog&action=viewproduct&prodid=272 | title=Street Lethal release information | accessdate=August 2, 2010}}</ref>
Gschoesser left the band. Guitarist Bart Walsh, former member of David Lee Roth Band, connected Gschoesser with the American band Icebreaker. Gschoesser replaced the drummer, [[Eric Singer]]. The band performed at Los Angeles nightclubs [[Roxy Theatre (West Hollywood)|The Roxy]] and [[Whisky A Go Go]].
After three years in Los Angeles, Gschoesser returned to Austria when his visa expired.
==Speedgig== Back in Austria in 2011, Gschoesser started Speedgig, a social network that allows musicians from all over the world to connect with each other and gain access to the music industry.
==Personal life== Gschoesser resides in Austria with his wife and two children.
==Discography==
===Racer X=== * ''[[Street Lethal]]'' (1986)
=== No Bros <ref>Official Homepage: [http://www.nobros.com/pics/lps/releases.htm Discography]</ref>=== * 1983: ''Our Own Way'' (LP/MC) * 1983: ''Hey You'' (Single) * 1983: ''Princess of My Town'' (Single) * 1983: ''Friends Will Keep Together'' (Single) * 1986: ''Cavalry of Evil'' (LP/MC) * 1986: ''Lady of the Tower'' (Promo Single) * 1986: ''So Hard To See'' (Single) * 1993: ''Nothing But Crumbs'' (CD) * 1996: ''Rough and Rare'' (CD) * 2001: ''The Greatest & The Rarest'' (CD)
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{Racer X}}

revision.text:
'''Henk Gerard Sol''' (born 11 August 1951 in [[Borger, Netherlands]]) is a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] [[organizational theorist]] and Emeritus Professor<ref>[https://www.pblq.nl/nl/over-pblq/organisatie/hoogleraren pblq hoogleraren], at pblq.nl. Accessed 21-05-2017.</ref> of [[Business Engineering]] and ICT at [[Groningen University]]. His research focuses on the development of services enabled by [[Information and communication technologies|ICT]], [[management information systems]], decision enhancement and [[telematics]].<ref name="MIT"> [http://www.mitportugal.org/external-review-committee/hsol.html Prof. Henk Sol] at mitportugal.org. Retrieved June 10 2009.</ref>
== Biography == Sol was born in 1951 near Groningen. In 1974 he received an M.A. in [[Econometrics]], [[Operations Research]] and [[Information Systems]] from the [[University of Groningen]]. In 1982 here he also received a PhD on the subject of "Simulation in Information Systems Development".<ref>[http://www.tbm.tudelft.nl/live/pagina.jsp?id=5dc326ba-b4a6-4593-8faa-b8a58c03b7ce&lang=en Prof. dr. Henk G. Sol bio] at TU Delft. Retrieved June 10 2009.</ref>
From 1974 to 1984 Sol was assistant professor at the [[University of Groningen]], where he was involved in the development and control of a Masters Program in Information Systems within the School of Economics and Management Science. In 1984 he became professor of Information Systems Development at [[Delft University of Technology]] (TU Delft), where he developed the Department of Information Systems to one of the leading Information Engineering Schools in Europe. In 1992 he became Professor of [[Systems Engineering]] at Delft University of Technology.Since 2004 he is Professor of Business Engineering and ICT at [[Groningen University]].
From 1992 to 1998 Sol was founding Dean of the new School for Engineering, Policy Analysis and Management at the TU Delft. He prepared the merger, in 1998, into the [[Faculty of Technology, Policy and Management]] (TPM). From 1999 to 2004 he was appointed as Scientific Director of Delft Institute for Information technology in Systems Engineering (DITSE). From 2000 tot 2003 he was again Dean of the Faculty of Technology, Policy & Management. From 2004 to 2008 he was founding Dean of the Faculty of Economic and Business at the [[University of Groningen]]. He is also an external review at the MIT Portugal Program that was launched in October 2006
He serves or acts in editorial roles with journals as "Decision Support Systems", "Electronic Journal of E-commerce", "Organizational Science", "Communications of AIS" and "Information and Management". He is member of [[IFIP TC 8]], W.G. 8.1, 8.2, 8.4 and one of the founding fathers of AIS as one of its first vice-presidents.
Sol has acted as a [[management consultant]] for several governments and large range of national and international organizations since 1972. He is chairman/member of the (Supervisory) Board of Directors of several companies, currently at [[Joh. Enschedé]] BV, and [[Groningen Airport Eelde]] NV.
He received the [[IFIP]] Outstanding Service Award as well as the [[IFIP]] Silver Core. In 2003 the TU Delft TPM Faculty initiated an annual Henk G. Sol Award for faculty members and PhD students for the best paper or publication, in honor of Prof. Henk Sol, who may be regarded as the "founding father" of TPM.<ref>[http://www.tbm.tudelft.nl/live/pagina.jsp?id=72b1e947-b726-4bee-934f-9923e3687cfc&lang=nl&binary=/doc/Q1_2EN.pdfTPM Quarterly 01 10 2003]. Accessed June 10 2009.</ref>
== Publications == He is a well-known author with a few hundred publications in the fields of ICT, management information systems, decision support systems and telematics.<ref>[http://www.tudelft.nl/live/pagina.jsp?id=91942c3b-4768-41c7-a650-e894c7521655&lang=en Publications Henk G. Sol 1994-2007] op tudelft.nl. Accessed June 10 2009.]</ref><ref>[http://www.informatik.uni-trier.de/~ley/db/indices/a-tree/s/Sol:Henk_G=.html Henk G. Sol] List of publications from the DBLP Bibliography Server. Retrieved June 10 2009.</ref> A selection: * 1982. ''Simulation in information systems development''. Dissertation University of Groningen * 1982. ''Information systems design methodologies : a comparative review : proceedings of the IFIP WG 8.1 Working Conference on Cooperative Review of Information Systems Design Methodologies, Noordwijkerhout, The Netherlands, 10-14 May 1982''. Ed. with [[T. William Olle]] and [[A.A. Verrijn Stuart]]. North-Holland. {{ISBN|0-444-86407-5}} * 1987. ''Expert systems and artificial intelligence in decision support systems : proceedings of the second Mini Euroconference, Lunteren, The Netherlands, 17-20 November 1985''. Ed. with Cees A.Th. Takkenberg and Pieter F. de Vries Robbé. Reidel. {{ISBN|90-277-2437-7}} * 1991. ''Dynamic modelling of information systems I''. Edited with Kees van Hee. North-Holland {{ISBN|0-444-88923-X}} * 2008. ''Decision enhancement services : rehearsing the future for decisions that matter''. With Peter G.W. Keen. IOS Press. {{ISBN|978-1-58603-837-3}}
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.solinfo.nl/henk-sol/ Prof.dr. Henk G. Sol] at solinfo.nl * [http://www.rug.nl/feb/news/2014/fellow-award-association-of-information-systems-voor-henk-g.-sol Fellow Award Association of Information Systems voor Henk G. Sol]
{{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sol, Henk G.}} [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Borger-Odoorn]] [[Category:Dutch business theorists]] [[Category:Dutch operations researchers]] [[Category:Information systems researchers]] [[Category:Systems scientists]] [[Category:University of Groningen alumni]] [[Category:Delft University of Technology faculty]] [[Category:University of Groningen faculty]]

revision.text:
'''Ibar Esteban Pérez Corradi''' (born July 16, 1977), usually identified as '''Esteban Pérez Corradi''', is an [[Argentina|Argentinian]] pharmaceutical entrepreneur who has been imprisoned for [[narcotics trafficking]] and [[money laundering]] and suspected of connections with a [[triple crime]] that took place in Argentina in 2008. At the time of his capture, on June 19, 2016 in Paraguay, he had been at large since March 20, 2012
==Career== After working for the National Bank from 1996 to 2002, during which time he also became involved in the narcotics trade, he became a successful financier in 2006.
He co-owns two firms, Odín Concept SRL, a pharmaceutical house, in which his partner is Pablo Héctor Quaranta, and C&C Building, a construction company, in which his partner is Martín Eduardo Lanatta.
In May 2008, Pérez Corradi became president of Elaboradora de Productos Biológicos S.A., while his “right-hand man,” Jorge Cabrera, became director of the firm.<ref name=not1>{{cite web| title =Quién es Pérez Corradi, el hombre clave en el triple crimen de General Rodríguez | work =La Noticia| url =http://www.lanoticia1.com/noticia/quien-es-perez-corradi-el-profugo-del-triple-crimen-de-general-rodriguez-27694.html}}</ref><ref name=sepr>{{cite web| title =Detienen a Pérez Corradi, el puente hacia Aníbal F. en torno al triple crimen de Gral. Rodríguez| work =Seprin| url =http://1seprin.com/2012/03/20/detienen-a-perez-corradi-el-puente-hacia-anibal-f-en-torno-al-triple-crimen-de-gral-rodriguez/}}</ref>
==Drug trafficking== He is said to have trafficked in illegal narcotics, including [[ephedrine]].<ref name=perf>{{cite web| title =Quién es Pérez Corradi, el principal sospechoso| work =Perfil| url =http://www.perfil.com/ediciones/domingo/-20123-662-0058.html}}</ref> One source describes him as a member of a “cartel” that dealt in “precursor chemicals”;<ref name=not1/> another identifies him as a member of a “drug mafia.”<ref name=info>{{cite web| title =La Corte concedió la extradición de Pérez Corradi a los EEUU| work =Infobae| url =http://www.infobae.com/2011/01/27/558908-la-corte-concedio-la-extradicion-perez-corradi-los-eeuu}}</ref> It has been reported that he got rich selling ephedrine to Mexicans, and that his suppliers were named Alfredo Abrahams and Josué Fucks (sic).<ref name=goog>{{Google books |id=EGvrZYVfsNsC |page=PR3-IA8 |title=La ejecución: La historia secreta del triple crimen que desnudó la conexión con la mafia de lo }}</ref>
The “drug mafia” or “cartel” to which Perez Corradi belongs has been linked to Argentine president [[Cristina Fernández]], a large percentage of whose campaign funds in 2007 came from pharmaceutical firms.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.perfil.com/contenidos/2009/09/04/noticia_0031.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-03-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924090342/http://www.perfil.com/contenidos/2009/09/04/noticia_0031.html |archivedate=2015-09-24 |df= }} </ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.perfil.com/contenidos/2009/09/26/noticia_0014.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-03-05 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924090358/http://www.perfil.com/contenidos/2009/09/26/noticia_0014.html |archivedate=2015-09-24 |df= }} </ref>
At one time, Pérez Corradi reportedly worked “informally” in the laboratory of [[Biopharma]], a firm that contributed money to Cristina Kirchner's presidential campaign.<ref name=sepr/>
In recent years, Perez Corradi's name has been raised in connection with many drug trafficking cases.<ref name=gace>{{cite web| title =El empresario Ibar Perez Corradi es el primer liberado| work =Gaceta Mercantil| url =http://www.gacetamercantil.com/notas/11198/el-empresario-ibar-perez-corradi-es-primer-liberado.html}}</ref> A few months after the so-called General Rodriguez triple murder (see below) in August 2008, he was one of several high-profile figures investigated for ephedrine trafficking and illegal trade in medicines that were the basis for ephedrine and [[crystal meth]].<ref name=pultz>{{cite web| title =Guinea Bissau: The Latin American connection| work =Pulitzer Center| url =http://pulitzercenter.org/blog/untold-stories/guinea-bissau-latin-american-connection-drug-trafficking}}</ref>
In August 2009, ''La Nación'' reported that the Federal Court of [[San Isidro, Buenos Aires|San Isidro]] had ordered the extradition of Pérez Corradi to the [[United States]]. This order was a response to an order of capture issued by a court in the state of [[Maine]], which accused Pérez Corradi of having sent a parcel into the U.S. containing 80 [[oxycodone]] tablets, and which had led to the detention of Pérez Corradi on October 22, 2008.<ref>http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1162652-ordenan-la-extradicion-de-perez-corradi-a-los-estados-unidos</ref> A request for his release was rejected in September 2010.<ref>{{cite web| title =Rechazan libertad de Pérez Corradi| work =Marandu| url =http://www.momarandu.com/amanoticias.php?a=7&b=1&c=108220}}</ref>
In January 2011, the ''Buenos Aires Clarin'' reported that the [[Argentinian Supreme Court]] had approved the extradition of Pérez Corradi to the United States on charges of trafficking in oxycodone, thus upholding the decision of the San Isidro court.<ref name=info/>
==Money laundering== Pérez Corradi, according to one source, laundered money through the [[Guinea Bissau]] consulate in Buenos Aires.<ref name=pultz/>
In December 2010, Judge Norberto Oyarbide indicted Pérez Corradi in Argentina for money laundering, in a case involving the assets of pharmaceutical entrepreneur [[Néstor Lorenzo]], arrested banking union leader Juan José Zanola, and the late Sebastian Forza. The charges also linked Pérez Corradi with ephedrine trafficking and with a case involving tampered medicine.<ref name=info/><ref>{{cite web| title =Jaime charged with corruption| work =Buenos Aires Herald| date =Dec 4, 2010| url =http://www.buenosairesherald.com/article/53045/jaime-charged-with-corruption}}</ref>
In 2011, Pérez Corradi was placed in pretrial detention in Argentina on charges of money laundering.<ref name=perf/> On December 15, 2011, he was released from prison after paying a bail of 100,000 pesos.<ref name=gace/> At the time of his release, he was still facing the possibility of being extradited to the United States on drug trafficking charges.<ref name=gace/>
==Triple murder== {{main|Triple crime}} On August 7, 2008, Sebastián Forza, Damian Ferron, and Leopoldo Bina were murdered in a house in the Quilmes neighborhood of [[Buenos Aires]]. Their bodies were stored in a freezer and eventually thrown in a ditch in another part of the city, where they were found on August 13. The men were killed, according to one source, “in perfect mafia style,” and all three of them had ties to the pharmaceutical business. Peréz Corradi was reportedly in [[Cancún]] at the time of the triple murder.
On March 20, 2012, the [[Argentinian Ministry of Justice]] issued a warrant for Pérez Corradi in connection with the triple murder, of which he is believed to be the mastermind. During the succeeding months, several raids were conducted in various places but Pérez Corradi was not found. He remains a fugitive, and is named by [[Interpol]] as one of the world's most wanted fugitives.
On December 20, 2012, two pairs of brothers, Martin and Cristian Lanatta and Victor and Marcelo Schillaci, were convicted of participation in the crime and sentenced to life in prison. The motive, according to the court, was that Forza, Ferron, and Bina's efforts to become involved in drug trafficking had threatened the narcotics trade of Pérez Corradi and his business partner Martin Lanatta.<ref name=goog/><ref>http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201308/27948-a-cinco-anos-del-crimen-no-pueden-detener-al-profugo-perez-corradi.html</ref>
The triple murder is the subject of a book, ''La Ejecución: La historia secreta del triple crimen que desnudó la conexión con la mafia de los medicamentos y la recaudación de la campaña K'' (''The Execution: The Secret History of the Triple Murder that Laid Bare the Connection with the Pharmaceutical Mafia and the K Campaign Fund''). The book was written by Emilia Delfino and Rodrigo Alegre and published by [[Random House|Random House Mondadori]] in 2011.<ref name=goog/>
Corradi was reported detained in Paraguay on February 12, 2016;<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1870449-detuvieron-a-ibar-perez-corradi-en-paraguay-segun-sus-abogados|title= Detuvieron a Ibar Pérez Corradi en Paraguay, según sus abogados|trans-title=Ibar Pérez Corradi was detained in Paraguay, according to his lawyers|language= Spanish|author= |date= February 12, 2016|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=February 7, 2016}}</ref> but it was reported later that he was still at large.
He was captured in the Triple Border on June 9, 2016, with a new paraguayan ID and with his fingerprints removed. The judges [[Sebastián Casanello]] and [[María Servini de Cubria]] asked for his extradition: Casanello works on the triple crime case, and Servini de Cubría on a case of drugs trafficking. Corradi refused t be extradited, claiming that he does not trust the Argentine judiciary, that his family is in Paraguay, and that his life would be at risk if he returns. As a result, the extradition request may take two months to be answered.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1911017-ibar-perez-corradi-se-nego-a-un-proceso-abreviado-de-extradicion-y-se-demoraria-dos-meses-su-traslado-a-la-argentina|title= Ibar Pérez Corradi se negó a ser extraditado y apuntó contra el kirchnerismo y el juez Casanello|trans-title=Ibar Pérez Corradi refused to be extradited, and pointed to Kirchnerism and judge Casanello|language= Spanish|author= Ivan Ruiz|date= June 21, 2016|publisher= La Nación|accessdate=June 12, 2016}}</ref>
==Personal life== Perez Corradi has been described as a man of few words who keeps a low profile. “He is not the sort who puts all his eggs in one basket.”<ref name=goog/> He and his ex-wife, Liliana Raquel Aurehhuliu, have three children.<ref name=perf/><ref>http://www.uif.gov.ar/uif/index.php/es/noticias/475-nuevas-medidas-en-la-causa-contra-un-lavador-vinculado-a-la-mafia-de-medicamentos</ref> He is said to have a home in Pilar, in Buenos Aires, and another in [[Spain]], which has proven “very useful” in connection with the export of illicit substances to Europe.<ref name=sepr/>
==References== {{Reflist}}

{{primary sources|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox Radio show |show_name = In Business |image = |imagesize = |caption = |other_names = |format = |runtime = 30 mins |country = UK |language = English |home_station = BBC Radio 4 |syndicates = |television = |presenter = [[Peter Day (broadcaster)|Peter Day]] |starring = |announcer = |creator = |writer = |director = |senior_editor = |editor = |producer = |exec_producer = |narrated = |rec_location = |first_aired = February 1983 |last_aired = |num_series = |num_episodes = |audio_format = |opentheme = |othertheme = |endtheme = |website = [http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b006qyyb Website] |podcast = [http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/radio/worldbiz/rss.xml Podcasts] }} '''''In Business''''' is a half-hour documentary programme on [[BBC Radio 4]].
==Format== It is presented by the BBC's Business Correspondent [[Peter Day (BBC broadcaster)|Peter Day]], and is broadcast at 8:30 p.m. on Thursdays and repeated at 9:30 p.m. on Sundays. It is the sister program of Global Business, which is also presented by Day and is broadcast on the [[BBC World Service]].
==History== It began as an introductory programme on Tuesday 1 February 1983, being presented by [[Peter Hobday (presenter)|Peter Hobday]]. From Tuesday 8 February it began as a half hour series at 8.35pm. From October 1984, it moved to 8.15pm. From October 1985, it was presented by Peter Smith, and moved to 7.20pm on Wednesdays and a repeat at 9.35am on Thursdays. In November 1987, it was at repeated at 4pm on Tuesdays, and on Thursdays in 1989. Peter Day joined in 1988. By 1991 it was at 8.45pm on Wednesdays and repeated at 7pm on Tuesdays. In 1992 it moved to 9pm on Wednesdays. Later in the year it moved to 8.45pm and the repeat moved to 7pm on Sundays. By the early 1990s, the programme was receiving a higher profile but was only broadcast on Sundays in 1994. In 1995 it moved to 6.30pm. By 1997, the internet was becoming of interest to business and to the programme.
In May 1998 it moved to 8.30pm on Mondays, and once more became a weekday programme. In January 2000, it moved to its present schedule of 8.30pm on Thursdays with a repeat at 9.30pm on Sundays.
==Podcasts== Its podcast is one of the most popular the BBC produces.
==See also== * ''[[The Money Programme]]'' (BBC2) * ''[[Wake Up to Money]]'' (5 Live)
==External links== * [http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio4/news/inbusiness/inbusiness.shtml Website] * [http://www.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/series/worldbiz/ Podcast]
{{BBC Radio 4}}

revision.comment: /* Quality of aluminum alloys */
revision.text:
The '''International Annealed Copper Standard''' ('''IACS''') is a [[Standard (metrology)|standard]] established in 1914 by the United States Department of Commerce.<ref>{{cite techreport |series=Circular of the Bureau of Standards No.31 |title=Copper Wire Tables, |date=October 1, 1914 |edition=3d |publisher=United States Department of Commerce |url=https://archive.org/details/copperwiretables31unituoft}}</ref> It is an empirically derived standard value for the [[electrical conductivity]] of commercially available [[copper]].
Sometime around 1913 several copper samples from 14 important refiners and wire manufacturers were analyzed by the [[U.S. Bureau of Standards]]. The average [[Electrical resistance|resistance]] of the samples was determined to be 0.15292 [[Ohm|Ω]] for copper wires with a mass of 1 [[gram]] of uniform [[Cross section (geometry)|cross section]] and 1 [[meter]] in length at 20 °C. In the United States this is usually written as "0.15292 ohm (meter, gram) at 20 °C".
Germany proposed a slight modification of this value to "0.15328 ohm (meter, gram) at 20 °C", this being equivalent to a conductivity of exactly {{val|58|e=6|u=[[Siemens (unit)|S]]|up=m}} at 20 °C. The German modification was adopted by the [[International Electrotechnical Commission]] in 1913 and subsequently published by the [[United States Department of Commerce]] on October 1, 1914 as the International Annealed Copper Standard (IACS).
The standard is most often used as a comparative property in the specification of the conductivity of other metals. For example, the conductivity of a particular grade of [[titanium]] may be specified as 1.2 % IACS, meaning that its electrical conductivity is 1.2 % of the copper specified as the IACS standard.<ref> {{ cite web | title = Resistivity and Conductivity Units Converter | url=http://www.zappitec.com/en/calculator/ }} </ref>
The standard can be found at https://archive.org/stream/copperwiretables31unituoft#page/n0/mode/1up.
== Quality of aluminum alloys ==
[[Heat treatment]] will alter several properties of an alloy, many of which are important to a design engineer. A measurement of the electric conductivity of [[aluminum alloys]] can be used to verify that a heat treatment process has been done correctly. For example a component made of "7075" alloy which was correctly treated with the process "T73" to gain resistance to [[stress corrosion cracking]] will fall in the range of 38.0 to 43.0 % IACS.<ref> {{cite web | title = Stress Corrosion Cracking of Aluminum Alloys | last = | first = | date = June 2001 | website = Total Materia | publisher = | url = http://www.totalmateria.com/Article17.htm | access-date = 14 April 2016 }} </ref>
The acceptance criteria for electrical conductivity of finished or semi-finished parts of wrought aluminum alloys are contained in [[SAE International]] specification AMS2658 Hardness and Conductivity Inspection of Wrought Aluminum Alloy Parts. Here the values are given in reference to the IACS.
A method for measuring electrical conductivity is described in [[ASTM International]] specification ASTM E 1004 Electromagnetic (Eddy-Current) Measurements of Electrical Conductivity. Electrical conductivity meters with direct readout in %IACS are commercially available<ref>{{cite web | title = Eddy Current Conductivity Meter for Metals | last = | first = | date = | website = Zappitec | publisher = | url = http://www.zappitec.com/en/products | access-date = 26 September 2018 }}</ref>.
== References ==

{{redirect|IATT|the lake in Louisiana|Lake Iatt|the former International Association of Theatre Technicians|OISTAT}} {{Infobox company | name = IATT | logo = | type = Consortium | foundation = November, 2004 | location = Headquarters - California, USA
Key Affiliates - EU, Asia
Key Markets - China, Mexico, Brazil, South Africa, India, Pakistan | key_people = David McKnight, president
Christine Shaw, executive director
Leslee Xu, software council chair
Fanny Hwang, director asia-pac | industry = Technology Trade
Emerging Markets | products = Trade Missions, Conferences, Symposia, Strategic Services | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = | parent = | subsid = | homepage = [http://TechnologyTrade.org IATT - ''TechnologyTrade.org'']
[http://IATT.org.uk IATT UK Mirror]
[http://IATT.cn IATT China Mirror]
[http://IATT.eu IATT EU Mirror]
[http://IATT.in IATT India Mirror] | footnotes = }} The '''International Association for Technology Trade''' ('''IATT''') is a consortium of technology organizations, strategic advisors, government agencies and corporate members seeking to generate successful global business opportunities – with a key focus on [[China]] and [[emerging economies]]. IATT runs ongoing trade missions to developing regions, sponsors and co-promotes conferences and symposia, and provides strategic services to companies entering and expanding into [[emerging markets]]. ==Recent noteworthy events== ===2006 Guangdong Province Educational Technology Buyers' Summit=== In June 2006, IATT hosted a high-level delegation from the '''[[Guangdong]] Province Department of Education''', visiting North America at summit meetings arranged by IATT in [[Toronto]], ON; [[Washington, DC]] and [[San Jose, CA]]. Highlights included meetings with representatives from '''[[Discovery Communications]]''', the [http://www.oraclefoundation.org '''Oracle Education Foundation'''] and '''[[Adobe Systems]]''' among other '''[[International Society for Technology in Education|ISTE]] 100''' companies. ISTE was a co-organizer of the summit, designed to introduce leading educational technology companies in North America to potential buyers in China. ===First Sino-American Forum of Intellectual Property Rights=== Efforts in 2005 to forge a partnership with the '''Patent Protection Association of China''' [http://ppac.org.cn/en/ '''(PPAC)'''] under the direction of China’s [[State Intellectual Property Office]] (SIPO) resulted in the first-ever ''Sino-American Forum of [[Intellectual Property]] Rights'', held in China’s booming [[Pearl River Delta]].Knezek, Don. [http://www.iste.org/AM/Template.cfm?Section=News_and_Events&TEMPLATE=/CM/ContentDisplay.cfm&CONTENTID=9374" "CEO's Update on China Expo and Intellectual Property Forum"], ''ISTE - News & Events'', October 28, 2005 Attracting more than 500 government officials, business leaders and academics from throughout China and North America, IATT and PPAC co-organized the event.editor. [http://www.glosk.com/CH/Macao/-2657867/pages/Dongguan/69794_en.htm "Dongguan - Foreign Direct Investment"], ''Glosk.com'', November, 2006 “IP continues to be a critical issue between China and the West, but what is especially exciting about this forum is the growing importance Chinese business leaders place on their own intellectual property. SIPO is racing toward half-a-million [[patent application]]s in 2005, 80% filed domestically – and the greatest number coming from the Pearl River Delta. Ultimately, Chinese business’ urging of the central government to protect IP rights will make a difference, because now it’s in everyone’s best interests.” (David McKnight, IATT president – speaking with a reporter from [[CCTV-9]] in China, October 2005) ===2005 China Educational Technology Conference & Expo=== During the same timeframe, and with its EdTech association partner ISTE,Knezek, Don. [https://www.iste.org/AM/Template.cfm?Section=News_and_Events&CONTENTID=8190&TEMPLATE=/CM/ContentDisplay.cfm "Letter from the CEO—ISTE in China"], ''ISTE - News & Events'', October 7, 2005 IATT co-organized what was identified as the world's largest educational technology conference and expo in [[Dongguan]], attracting nearly 40,000 attendees in its first year with leading EdTech speakers and a small number of non-China exhibitors from the US, Canada and UK.editor. [http://www.hellerreports.com/newsletters/ewhcontent/147.html "Business Opportunities in China – Find Out More During The Heller Reports' July 15th Roundtable Discussion"], ''The Heller Reports/Quality Education Data News Alert'', July 8, 2005 ==Notes== [[Category:International trade organizations]] [[Category:Business organizations based in the United States]]

revision.text:
{{Orphan|date=April 2016}}
[[File:Janice Marturano.jpg|thumb|Janice Marturano speaking at the 2014 World Economic Forum]] '''Janice Marturano''' (born 1957)<ref>{{cite news |title=Profile |url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P1-22480297.html |newspaper=The Record |location=Bergen County, NJ |date=June 20, 1995 |via=HighBeam Research |subscription=yes}}</ref> is an author, former vice president at [[General Mills]], and founder and executive director of the Institute for Mindful Leadership, a non-profit organization that educates business and organizational employees on strengthening the fundamentals of leadership excellence through [[mindfulness]] meditation, contemplative leadership practices and their practical applications in the workplace.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://instituteformindfulleadership.org/founder/ |title=Founder |website=Institute for Mindful Leadership}}</ref>
==Early life==
Marturano grew up in [[Clifton, New Jersey]], the child of first generation Italian immigrant parents. She graduated with a [[Juris Doctor]] (JD) from [[NYU School of Law]] in 1982.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.stern.nyu.edu/experience-stern/news-events/beyond-deep-breaths-transforming-workplace-through-mindfulness|title = NYU Hosts Panel on Mindfulness in the Workplace|last =|first =|date = April 14, 2015|website = New York University|access-date =}}</ref> She worked as a business lawyer at [[Curtis, Mallet-Prevost, Colt & Mosle]] and then as in-house counsel for [[Panasonic]] and [[Nabisco]].<ref name="FT" />
==General Mills==
Marturano joined [[General Mills]] in 1996, and became Deputy General Counsel and Vice President, Public Responsibility.<ref name="FT" /> She had a leading role in the complex eighteen-month business deal that occurred when General Mills acquired the [[Pillsbury Company]] in 2001; the timing of which coincided with the death of both her parents.<ref name="latimes">{{cite news|last = MacVean|first = Mary|date = February 16, 2015|title = Meditation Booms As People Seek a Way to Slow Down|url = http://www.latimes.com/health/la-he-c1-meditation-20150216-story.html|newspaper = Los Angeles Times|access-date = }}</ref> Looking for a way to regain her strength and health, she enrolled in a mindfulness workshop taught by [[Jon Kabat-Zinn]], the MIT PhD who created the [[Mindfulness-based stress reduction|Mindfulness based stress reduction (MBSR)]] framework.<ref name="FT">{{cite news |last = Gelles|first = David|date = August 24, 2012|title = The mind business|url = http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/d9cb7940-ebea-11e1-985a-00144feab49a.html|newspaper = FT Magazine|publisher = The Financial Times|access-date = }}</ref>
With a goal of sharing her own experience, Marturano developed Mindful Leadership training for her colleagues at General Mills.<ref name="FT" /> While still a corporate officer at General Mills, she received her mindfulness teacher certification from the [[University of Massachusetts Medical School|University of Massachusetts Medical School's]] Center for Mindfulness<ref>{{cite news |last=Hughlett |first=Mike |date=November 24, 2013 |title=MIndfulness Arrives in the Workplace |url=http://www.startribune.com/mindfulness-arrives-in-the-twin-cities-workplace/233176121/ |newspaper=Star Tribune |location=Minneapolis |access-date=}}</ref> and went on to co-develop the first mindful leadership curricula at the [[University of Massachusetts Medical School|University of Massachusetts Medical School's]] Center for Mindfulness where she later served as a member of the Advisory Board.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.umassmed.edu/uploadedFiles/cfm2/AnnualReport_CFM_UMass_08-4.pdf|title=Center for Mindfulness Annual Report 2008|website=University of Massachusetts Medical School}}</ref> In 2008, this Mindful Leadership training was opened to leaders from other organizations.
==Mindful Leadership==
In order to teach Mindful Leadership full-time, Marturano left General Mills in 2010 and founded the [http://www.instituteformindfulleadership.org Institute for Mindful Leadership]. Combining mindfulness with her experience as a former officer of a Fortune 200 company, she developed curricula to bring training in mindful leadership to leaders from corporate, non-profit, academic, government, and military organizations.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/08/05/50-over-50_n_5648506.html|title = 50 Over 50: Career Reinvention|last =|first =|date = August 5, 2014|website = Huff Post/ Post 50|publisher = Huffington Post|access-date =}}</ref> She heads a team of instructors experienced in mindfulness training and with a variety of organizational leadership backgrounds; they collaborate to tailor curricula to suit individual clients, as well as offering programs to the general public.
In 2013, she was invited to the [[World Economic Forum]] in Davos, Switzerland<ref name="NYT" /> to share her understanding of the importance of mindful leadership. She spoke again at the 2014 World Economic Forum Conference in Tianjin, China and has been a featured speaker at the Wisdom 2.0 Business Conference in NY, Global Mindful Leadership Conference in Australia, and Mindful Leadership Forum in Washington, DC.
Marturano's writings and work have been featured on BBC News,<ref>{{cite news|last = Beckett|first = Tanya|date = January 29, 2013|title = Can 'mindful' meditation increase profits?|url = https://www.bbc.com/news/business-21244171|work = BBC News|access-date =}}</ref> and in ''The New York Times'',<ref name="NYT">{{cite news|last = Tugend|first = Alina|date = March 22, 2013|title = In Mindfulness, a Method to Sharpen Focus and Open Minds|url = https://www.nytimes.com/2013/03/23/your-money/mindfulness-requires-practice-and-purpose.html?emc=eta1&_r=1&|newspaper = The New York Times|access-date =}}</ref> ''The Financial Times'',<ref name="FT" /> ''Time'' magazine,<ref>{{cite magazine|last = Pickert|first = Kate|date = January 23, 2013|title = The Mindful Revolution|url = http://time.com/1556/the-mindful-revolution/|magazine = Time|access-date =|subscription=yes}}</ref> and the ''Los Angeles Times''.<ref name="latimes" />
In March 2016, [[Arianna Huffington]] selected Janice Marturano as a Huffington Post Pioneer, a HuffPost Originals video series that profiles leaders in various industries.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/janice-marturano-mindful-leadership_us_56e81b1ae4b0b25c91833a84|title=The 'Perfect Storm' That Turned Janice Marturano Into A Mindful Leader|last=Gregoire|first=Carolyn|date=March 17, 2016|website=The Huffington Post|publisher=Arianna Huffington |type=Editorial |access-date=}}</ref>
== ''Finding the Space to Lead: A Practical Guide to Mindful Leadership'' == Janice Marturano's first book, ''Finding the Space to Lead: A Practical Guide to Mindful Leadership''<ref>{{cite magazine |title=Book Review: Finding the Space to Lead A Practical Guide to Mindful Leadership |url=http://www.publishersweekly.com/978-1-62040-247-4 |magazine=Publishers Weekly |access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |title=Booklist Review: Finding the Space to Lead A Practical Guide to Mindful Leadership |url=http://www.booklistonline.com/Finding-the-Space-to-Lead-A-Practical-Guide-to-Mindful-Leadership-Janice-Marturano/pid=6459928 |magazine=Booklist Review |access-date=}}</ref> ([[Bloomsbury Publishing|Bloomsbury Press]], 2014), won a 2014 Silver [[Nautilus Book Awards|Nautilus Book Award]] in the category of Business/Leadership<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nautilusbookawards.com/2014_SILVER_Winners.html |title=2014 Silver Winners |website=Nautilus Book Awards |access-date=}}</ref> and has been translated into many languages. ''Finding the Space to Lead'' is required reading for several university programs including the University of Southern California Marshall School of Business<ref>{{cite web|url=http://web-app.usc.edu/soc/syllabus/20151/16722.pdf|title=MOR-598: Leading with Mindfulness and Compassion Course Syllabus|last=Weiss|first=Allen|date=January 12, 2015|website=University of Southern California Marshall School of Business|access-date=}}</ref> and New York University Stern School of Business' Mindfulness in Business Initiative.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.stern.nyu.edu/experience-stern/tales-in-possible/meditate-possible-jonathan-cook|title=Meditate Possible|last=|first=|date=April 28, 2015|website=New York University Stern School of Business|access-date=}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://instituteformindfulleadership.org Institute for Mindful Leadership] * [http://findingthespacetolead.com Finding the Space to Lead Book]

{{Infobox person | name = Lee Seng Wee | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date|1930|4|4}} | birth_place = [[Singapore]] | death_date = {{death date and age|2015|8|7|1930|4|4}} | death_place = Singapore | death_cause = Head injury from falling | residence = Singapore | nationality = [[Singaporean]] | other_names = | education = | alma_mater = [[University of Toronto]],
[[University of Western Ontario]] | occupation = Businessman | years_active = | organization = [[Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation]],
[[Lee Foundation]] | known_for = | salary = | net_worth = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = [[Lee Kong Chian]] (father)
Tan Ai Leh (mother) | relatives = [[Tan Kah Kee]] (maternal grandfather)
[[Lee Seng Gee]] (brother)
[[Lee Seng Tee]] (brother) | awards = | signature = | website = }} {{chinese name|[[Li (李)|Lee]]}} '''Lee Seng Wee''', {{post-nominals|list=[[Darjah Utama Bakti Cemerlang|DUBC]]}} ({{zh|s=李成伟|t=李成偉|p=Lǐ Chéngwěi|poj=Lí Sîng-uí}}; April 4, 1930{{spaced ndash}}August 7, 2015) was a [[Singapore]]an banker and businessman. == Early life == Lee was the third son of rubber tycoon [[Lee Kong Chian]], and grandson of Singaporean pioneer [[Tan Kah Kee]]. He was educated at the [[Anglo-Chinese School]] in Singapore{{Cite web|url=http://www.blueskiescom.com/alumni/oct_nov_15/memoriam.html|title=In Memoriam - Mr Lee Seng Wee|website=www.blueskiescom.com|access-date=2017-08-29}} and subsequently studied engineering at the [[University of Toronto]]. He graduated first in his MBA class from the University of Western Ontario.{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=v9QEBAAAQBAJ&source=gbs_navlinks_s|title=Southeast Asian Personalities of Chinese Descent: A Biographical Dictionary, Volume I & II|last=Suryadinata|first=Leo|date=2012|publisher=Institute of Southeast Asian Studies|isbn=9789814345217|location=|pages=541|language=en}} == Career == Lee joined the Lee Rubber Company after returning to Singapore and rose to the position of vice-chairman. He then became a director of Southeast Asia's second-largest bank, [[Oversea-Chinese Banking Corporation]] (OCBC) from 1966 until 2016, and Chairman from 1995 to 2003.{{Cite news|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/former-ocbc-bank-chairman-lee-seng-wee-dies-aged-85-8233784|title=Former OCBC Bank chairman Lee Seng Wee dies aged 85|work=Channel NewsAsia|access-date=2017-08-29|language=en-US}} He orchestrated a S$2.4 billion takeover bid for Singapore's then-fifth largest bank, Keppel Capital Holdings in June 2001.{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/lee-seng-wee/|title=Lee Seng Wee|work=Forbes|access-date=2017-08-29|language=en}} In 2003, Lee stepped down as chairman and moved to a non-executive position, but continued to guide the strategic direction of the bank. Major investments and acquisitions during his long tenure include OCBC-NISP in Indonesia, OCBC China Bank, OCBC-Wing Hang in Hong Kong; the private banking business of ING Asia Bank, majority control of Great Eastern Life Insurance and a 20 percent stake in Bank of Ningbo in China. The net profit after tax for OCBC Group was almost S$4 billion for 2015. In addition to his role in OCBC, Lee was also a director of several companies, including Lee Rubber Group Companies and [[Lee Foundation]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.businesstimes.com.sg/banking-finance/former-ocbc-chairman-lee-seng-wee-dies-aged-85|title=Former OCBC chairman Lee Seng Wee dies, aged 85|last=U-Wen|first=Lee|work=The Business Times|access-date=2017-08-29|language=en}} He served as a board member of the [[Government of Singapore Investment Corporation]] and on the Council of Presidential Advisors, Singapore. He was conferred the Distinguished Service Order in 2001. In 2006, he received the Woodrow Wilson Award in New York for Singapore. == Death == On August 7, 2015, at the age of 85, Lee died of complications arising from a head injury sustained during a fall at home. Lee leaves behind a wife and three children and six grandchildren.{{Cite web|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/business/banking/former-ocbc-chairman-lee-seng-wee-dies-aged-85|title=Former OCBC chairman Lee Seng Wee dies aged 85, Banking News & Top Stories - The Straits Times|date=2015-08-10|access-date=2017-08-29|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150810173634/http://www.straitstimes.com/business/banking/former-ocbc-chairman-lee-seng-wee-dies-aged-85|archivedate=2015-08-10|df=}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Lee, Seng Wee}} [[Category:1930 births]] [[Category:2015 deaths]] [[Category:Singaporean billionaires]] [[Category:Singaporean businesspeople]] [[Category:Singaporean people of Hokkien descent]] [[Category:University of Toronto alumni]] [[Category:University of Western Ontario alumni]] [[Category:Recipients of the Darjah Utama Bakti Cemerlang]] {{Singapore-business-bio-stub}}

page.title: List of Sukhoi Superjet 100 orders and deliveries

revision.comment: Update.
revision.text:
{{Main|Sukhoi Superjet 100}} [[File:Air-to-air photo of a Sukhoi Superjet 100 (RA-97004) over Italy.jpg|thumb|250x250px|A Superjet 100 flying off the coast of Italy near [[Sanremo]]]] This article lists firm orders and deliveries for the '''[[Sukhoi Superjet 100]]''', currently in production by [[Sukhoi|Sukhoi Civil Aircraft]], a division of the [[United Aircraft Corporation]]. It is impossible to confirm the accuracy of the Superjet order backlog as the manufacturer does not provide up to date order information, and there have been no updates on many longstanding orders.{{cite web|url=http://www.superjetinternational.com/media-center/sukhoi-superjet-100-orders-update/|title=Sukhoi Superjet 100 Orders Update|work=superjetinternational.com|accessdate=1 May 2017}} == Orders and deliveries ==
{| style="border:solid 1px #aaa;" cellpadding="10" cellspacing="0" |+'''Net orders and deliveries (cumulative by year)''' | ImageSize = width:auto height:180 barincrement:30 PlotArea = left:50 bottom:15 top:10 right:18 AlignBars = justify DateFormat = yyyy Period = from:0 till:350 TimeAxis = orientation:vertical ScaleMajor = unit:year increment:50 start:0 PlotData= color:skyblue width:30 align:center bar:2008 from:start till:30 text:30 bar:2009 from:start till:45 text:45 bar:2010 from:start till:45 text:45 bar:2011 from:start till:67 text:67 color:green bar:2011 from:start till:5 text:5 color:skyblue width:30 align:center bar:2012 from:start till:67 text:67 color:green bar:2012 from:start till:13 text:13 color:skyblue width:30 align:center bar:2013 from:start till:69 text:69 color:green bar:2013 from:start till:27 text:27 color:skyblue width:30 align:center bar:2014 from:start till:82 text:82 color:green bar:2014 from:start till:54 text:54 color:skyblue width:30 align:center bar:2015 from:start till:140 text:140 color:green bar:2015 from:start till:75 text:75 color:skyblue width:30 align:center bar:2016 from:start till:168 text:168 color:green bar:2016 from:start till:96 text:96 color:skyblue width:30 align:center bar:2017 from:start till:196 text:196 color:green bar:2017 from:start till:121 text:121 color:powderblue width:30 align:center bar:2018 from:start till:301 text:301 color:green bar:2018 from:start till:147 text:147 |- |{{As of|2018|04|30}}{{Cite web|url=http://superjet100.info/registry-english|title=superjet 100 ?????????? ?????? ????????|last=|first=|date=|website=superjet100.info|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-09-11}} |}
{| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; background:#fbf8db;" |+Net orders and deliveries by year |- style="color:black; font-weight:bold; background:#cdf;" | ||2005||2006||2007||2008||2009||2010||2011||2012||2013||2014||2015||2016||2017||2018||Total |- |'''Orders'''||30||0||0||0||15||0||22||0||2||13||58||28||28||106||'''301''' |- |'''Deliveries'''|| colspan="6" | - ||5||8||14||27||21||21||25||26https://www.planespotters.net/production-list/Sukhoi/Superjet-100?sort=dd&dir=desc||'''147''' |} As of 30 April 2018 === Timeline === * '''Aug 2005''' – Finance Leasing Company and Sukhoi Civil Aircraft sign a sales contract for 10 aircraft of the new RRJ family for $262 million at MAKS-2005. * '''Dec 2005''' – Aeroflot signs the contract for the delivery of 30 Sukhoi Superjet 100s, thus becoming the program's launch customer. The total deal is valued at approximately $820 million. * '''19 Dec 2006''' – Sukhoi Civil Aircraft wins a $170 million order from [[Dalavia]] Far East Airways. * '''May 2007''' – Aeroflot and Sukhoi Civil Aircraft Company announces the signature of the Letter of Intent to purchase 15 aircraft of Sukhoi Superjet 100 family. Earlier, Aeroflot had already signed the contract for delivery of 30 SSJ-100s. According to the letter, the airline will purchase 15 SSJ100/95s in basic configuration with deliveries to start in May 2011. The airline also holds an option for another five aircraft of the family. The deal amounts at over $400 million. * '''Sep 2007''' – [[Armavia]] signs a multimillion-dollar agreement to buy four SSJ-100-95LR Superjets for regional flights. * '''Jul 2008''' – Avia Leasing acquires 24 Sukhoi Superjet 100 aircraft in basic configuration with an option for 16 additional aircraft on the second day of the 2008 Farnborough Airshow. The order has a total value of over $630 million. Order firmed at Paris Airshow on 16 Jun 2009. * '''Jul 2008''' – SuperJet International announces an order by an undisclosed renowned European customer for a fleet of 20 new Sukhoi Superjet 100 aircraft valued at approximately $600 million. * '''5 Dec 2008, Jakarta''' – Sukhoi Civil Aircraft Company and [[Kartika Airlines]] sign the Heads of Agreement for 15 Sukhoi Superjet 100s and another 15 optional aircraft. The order is valued at $448 million. Kartika Airlines is the first SSJ100 customer in Southeast Asia. * '''17 Jun 2009, Paris Airshow''' – [[Gazprom]] orders 10 Superjet 100 aircraft. * '''21 Aug 2009''' – [[Yakutia Airlines]] orders 2 Superjet 100 aircraft. * '''May 2010''' – Laos-based newcomer Phongsavanh Airlines plans to launch services in 2012 and buy three Sukhoi RRJ95 SuperJet 100s. * '''23 Jun 2010''' – [[European Aviation Safety Agency]] certification for the Superjet Engine SaM146. * '''19 Jul 2010''' – Sukhoi Civil Aircraft and Indonesia's regional carrier Kartika Airlines sign $951 mln deal on 30 SSJ100s. * '''20 Jul 2010''' – Orient Thai Airlines to buy at least 12 Superjet 100s from Sukhoi. * '''21 Jul 2010''' – [[SuperJet International]] scores order for 30 Superjets, 15 options. * '''1 Sep 2010''' – Aeroflot announced that as part of its plan to order additional domestic aircraft it planned to purchase an additional 10 aircraft in addition to its 30 prior orders. * '''2 Sep 2010''' – SuperJet International signs agreement up to US $300 million. * '''24 Nov 2010''' – Thailand's [[Orient Thai Airlines]] announced the purchase of 12 Sukhoi Superjet-100/95Bs civilian aircraft. * '''17 Jan 2011''' – Mexico's third largest airline [[Interjet]] signed a $650 million deal for 15 Sukhoi Superjet-100 civilian aircraft, with an option to purchase five more. It is the North American launch customer and is the first and, so far, the only airline of the Americas to order a Sukhoi Superjet 100. * '''3 Feb 2011''' – Sukhoi Superjet 100 obtained IAC AR Type Certificate * '''19 Apr 2011''' – The first production aircraft was delivered to [[Armavia]], celebrated with a ceremony in the Armenian capital [[Yerevan]]. * '''21 Apr 2011''' – The first commercial flight of Sukhoi SuperJet 100 with 90 passengers from [[Zvartnots International Airport]], [[Yerevan]], Armenia to [[Sheremetyevo International Airport]], Moscow. * '''16 Jun 2011''' – Aeroflot Russian Airlines's Superjet 100 completed its first passenger flight operating from [[Sheremetyevo International Airport]], Moscow, to [[Pulkovo International Airport]], St. Petersburg. * '''17 Jun 2011''' – Aeroflot Russian Airlines's Superjet 100 completed its first schedule flight operating from [[Sheremetyevo International Airport]], Moscow, to [[Nizhny Novgorod International Airport]], [[Nizhny Novgorod]]. * '''9 Oct 2011''' – Comlux becomes the launching customer of SuperJet International for this new type of VIP aircraft * '''19 Mar 2012''' – All seven SuperJet planes in service grounded to have landing gear defect repaired. "Within a week the whole fleet will have repairs conducted," said a company spokesman, three days after an Aeroflot SuperJet made an unscheduled landing at Moscow's Sheremetyevo Airport. * '''9 May 2012''' – [[Mount Salak Sukhoi Superjet 100 crash|Crash]] during a demonstration flight in Indonesia, with 45 fatalities and no survivors. * '''10 May 2012''' – Pakistan's [[Air Indus]] allegedly showed an interest in buying 8 SSJ-100 planes. * '''21 Jun 2012''' – [[Transaero]], Russia's number two carrier, signs a deal to buy up to 16 SSJ100 with delivery date starting 2015. * '''18 Jun 2013''' – Mexico's [[Interjet]] received its first Superjet 100 by Sukhoi at the Paris Air Show, another 19 Superjet 100s are due to be delivered in the coming months. * '''26 Aug 2015''' – Russian leasing company State Transport Leasing Co. (STLC) has signed a firm order for 32 Sukhoi Civil Aircraft Sukhoi Superjet 100 (SSJ100) aircraft at the [[MAKS (air show)]]. The aircraft will be leased to Russian ([[Yamal Airlines]] 25 aircraft) and foreign operators. * '''27 Aug 2015''' – President [[Vladimir Putin]] announces at the [[MAKS (air show)|MAKS air show]], an international military exhibition held in the Russian city of [[Ramenskoye Airport|Zhukovsky]], with Egyptian President [[Abdel Fattah el-Sisi]] attending the exhibition, that it seeks to sell 12 Superjet 100 by Sukhoi to [[Egypt]]. * '''3 Feb 2016''' – Egypt's [[Air Leisure]] signed a letter of intent in buying 4 SSJ-100 aircraft with an option of 6 more. * '''23 Jul 2017,''' [[MAKS (air show)|'''MAKS (airshow)''']] – 2017, Among MAKS’ biggest deals were a contract for the supplies of 20 Sukhoi Superjet 100 planes to [[Aeroflot]]. * '''25–28 Apr 2018, Eurasia Airshow''' – Four orders of 92 SSJ-100 aircraft made in letters of intention made with [[S7 Airlines|S7]], [[Iran Air Tours]], [[Iran Aseman Airlines|Aseman Airlines]], and [[Aero Mongolia]]. * '''10 Sep 2018''': [[Aeroflot]] reached an agreement for 100 Superjets in a two-class layout with 12 business seats and 75 in economy, to be delivered from 2019 to 2026.{{cite news |url= https://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/aeroflot-to-take-100-more-superjets-451796/ |title= Aeroflot to take 100 more Superjets |date= 10 Sep 2018 |author= Oliver Clark |work= Flightglobal}} === Orders === {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; background:#fbf8db;" |+ ! style="width: 10%; background-color:#ccddff;" data-sort-type="date" | Date ! style="background-color:#ccddff;" | Airline ! style="background-color:#ccddff;" |EIS
! style="background-color:#ccddff;" data-sort-type="number" | Orders ! style="background-color:#ccddff;" data-sort-type="number" | Options ! style="background-color:#ccddff;" data-sort-type="number" | Deliveries ! style="background-color:#d0f0c0;" data-sort-type="number" | Operated ! style="background-color:#ccddff;" class="unsortable"| Notes and references |- | 7 Dec 2005 | align="left" |[[Aeroflot]] | 2011 | style="text-align: center;" | 150 | style="text-align: center;" | - | style="text-align: center;" | 60* | style="text-align: center; background-color:#d0f0c0"| 50{{Cite news|url=http://www.rusaviainsider.com/aeroflot-superjet-grows-50-aircraft/|title=Aeroflot Sukhoi Superjet 100 fleet grows to 50 russian regional aircraft|date=2018-09-24|work=Russian Aviation Insider|access-date=2018-11-27|language=en-US}} | style="text-align: center;" | *Ten light versions with only two lavatories were replaced after one year with full version. Some of the ten were sold to [[Centre-South]] and [[Red Wings Airlines]].{{citation|title=ГСС и авиакомпания "Аэрофлот" подписали Акт сдачи-приемки самолета SSJ-100 MSN 95016 |url=http://www.aex.ru/news/2012/4/3/93996/|date=3 Apr 2012|publisher=Aviation Explorer|accessdate=13 May 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/aeroflot-commits-to-another-20-superjets-407938/|title=Aeroflot commits to another 20 Superjets|publisher=Flightglobal.com|accessdate=15 Jan 2015}} |- | 17 Jun 2009 | align="left" |[[Gazpromavia]] | 2013 | style="text-align: center;" | 10 | style="text-align: center;" | | style="text-align: center;" | 10 | style="text-align: center; background-color:#d0f0c0" | 10 | style="text-align: center;" |{{cite web|url=http://russianplanes.net/airline/Gazpromavia|title=✈ наша авиация|publisher=Russianplanes.net|date=|accessdate=2014-11-27|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141030174059/http://russianplanes.net/airline/Gazpromavia|archivedate=30 October 2014|df=dmy-all}} |- | 21 Aug 2009 | align="left" |[[Yakutia Airlines]] | 2012 | style="text-align: center;" | 5 | style="text-align: center;" | | style="text-align: center;" | 5 | style="text-align: center; background-color:#d0f0c0" | 3 | style="text-align: center;" | Fleet includes RA-89021 ex [[Red Wings Airlines]] airplane{{cite web|url=http://atwonline.com/aircraft-engines-components/news/yakutia-airline-takes-delivery-first-ssj100-1219|title=Yakutia Airline takes delivery of first SSJ100|publisher=|accessdate=14 Nov 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.aviaport.ru/digest/2016/10/21/398485.html|title=Yakutia Airline takes delivery of fourth SSJ100|publisher=|accessdate=20 Oct 2016}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.rusaviainsider.com/yakutia-superjet-100-damaged-beyond-repair/|title=Yakutia’s Superjet 100 damaged beyond repair in runway excursion|date=2018-10-10|work=Russian Aviation Insider|access-date=2018-10-19|language=en-US}} |- | 17 Jan 2011 | align="left" |[[Interjet]] | 2013 | style="text-align: center;" | 30{{cite web|url=http://www.superjetinternational.com/media-center/superjet-international-announces-additional-10-ssj100-for-interjet/|title=SuperJet International announces additional 10 SSJ100 for Interjet|publisher=}} | style="text-align: center;" | 10 | style="text-align: center;" | 22 | style="text-align: center; background-color:#d0f0c0" | 22 | style="text-align: center;" |''Olivier Bonnassies'' [http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/interjet-mandates-natixis-for-superjet-100-financing-400294 Interjet mandates Natixis for Superjet 100 financing] ''[[FlightGlobal]],'' London, 11 Jun 2014[https://archive.is/20130417123709/http://en.beta.rian.ru/business/20120710/174535248.html "Interjet Takes Up Option For Sukhoi Superjets."] ''RIA Novosti (En.beta.rian.ru)''. {{About|information and analysis of a commercial market|information to support marketing activities|Marketing intelligence}}
'''Market intelligence''' is the information relevant to a company’s markets, gathered and analyzed specifically for the purpose of accurate and confident [[decision-making]] in determining strategy in areas such as [[market opportunity]], [[market penetration]] strategy, and [[market development]].<ref name="Cornish">Cornish, S. L. “Product Innovation and the Spatial Dynamics of Market Intelligence: Does Proximity to Markets Matter?” Economic Geography. Volume: 73, Issue 2 (April 1997)</ref>
Market intelligence includes the process of gathering data from the company’s external environment, whereas the [[Business intelligence]] process primarily is based on internal recorded events – such as sales, shipments and purchases. The purpose of incorporating Market Information or intelligence into the Business Intelligence process is to provide decision makers with a more “complete picture” of ongoing corporate performance in a set of given market conditions.<ref name="Prescott">Prescott, John and others, Proven Strategies in Competitive Intelligence (Wiley, 2001)</ref>
== Gathering market intelligence data == Effective market intelligence needs accurate market information that is gathered with right tools and methods. To gather information companies can conduct [[survey (human research)|survey]]s, [[interview]]s, visit and monitor competitors outlets or gather and buy data from different sources.
Traditional interviews and surveys can be done either in-house or by using specialists agencies. As more and more markets are digitalized the market intelligence space has seen a lot of new digital tools that companies can use. There are tools such as [https://www.google.com/insights/consumersurveys/home Google Consumer Survey] that enables companies to ask web users a question through Google network of online publishers. There are also specialist sites companies can buy market intelligence information and market intelligence software that companies can use to collect and monitor data from the internet.

{{Use dmy dates|date=November 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = MaryJane Mwangi | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Kenya]] | death_date = | death_place = | residence = [[Nairobi]], [[Kenya]] | nationality = Kenyan | citizenship = Kenya | alma_mater = '''[[University of Nairobi]]'''
'''[https://www.ihrm.or.ke/ Institute of Human Resource Management]''' | occupation = [[Corporate Executive]] | years_active = 1990 — present | known_for = | home_town = | title = [[Chief Executive Officer]] of the [[National Oil Corporation of Kenya]] | spouse = {{small|'''Martin Mbogo'''}} | ethnicity = | networth = | religion = }} '''MaryJane Mwangi''', also '''Mary Jane Mwangi''', is a [[corporate executive]] in [[Kenya]], who serves as the [[managing director]] and [[chief executive officer]] of the [[National Oil Corporation of Kenya]], since August 2017.{{cite web|accessdate=3 November 2017 |url=http://www.businessdailyafrica.com/corporate/companies/National-Oil-acting-chief-executive-confirmed/4003102-4047742-1uemiqz/index.html | title=National Oil acting chief executive confirmed | last=Herbling | newspaper=[[Business Daily Africa]] |publisher=[[Nation Media Group]] | date=6 August 2017 |location=Nairobi | first=David}} ==Background and education== She graduated from the [[University of Nairobi]] with a [[Master of Business Administration]] degree in 2006. She also holds a [[Human resource management|Higher Diploma in Human Resource Management]], awarded in 2013, by the Institute of Human Resource Management (IHRM), based in [[Nairobi]], Kenya's capital and largest city.{{cite web| url=https://www.linkedin.com/in/maryjane-mwangi-576a5a11a/?trk=public-profile-join-page |title=MaryJane Mwangi: National Oil Corporation of Kenya |accessdate=3 November 2017 |date= 2016 |publisher=Linkedin Webpage of MryJane Mwangi |last=Mwangi |first=MaryJane}} ==Career== She started her long career in the consumer oil sector in 1993, working as an Export Manager for [[Agip|Agip Kenya Limited]] (AGKL), responsible for downstream distribution of fuels and oils from the depot in [[Mombasa]] to five countries in the [[African Great Lakes]] area, serving in that capacity until 1998. For one year, from 1998 until 1999, she served as the Customer Service Manager at AGKL. The next year, from 1999 until 2000, she served as the [[Liquefied petroleum gas|LPG]] Supervisor at AGKL. In 2000, she switched companies and moved over to [[Royal Dutch Shell| Shell]]/[[British Petroleum|BP]], as the LPG Manager, based in the coastal city of [[Malindi]], serving in that capacity until 2001. In 2001 she moved again, relocating to [[Chevron Corporation|Chevron]]/[[Caltex]] Kenya Limited, as a Sales Business Consultant, serving in that capacity for seven years. In 2008, Ms Mwangi was appointed the Head of Sales & Marketing division at the National Oil Corporation of Kenya (NOCK), serving in that capacity for the next five years. In July 2013, she was promoted to the position of General Manager, Downstream Operations at NOCK, serving in that capacity until July 2016, when she was appointed Acting Managing Director and Acting CEO.{{cite web|url=https://www.the-star.co.ke/news/2016/07/11/maryjane-mwangi-appointed-acting-national-oil-ceo_c1384345 |title=MaryJane Mwangi appointed acting National Oil CEO | accessdate=3 October 2017 |date=11 July 2016 |first=Patrick |last=Vidija |newspaper=[[The Star (Kenya)]] | location=Nirobi}} After performing in an active capacity for one year, MaryJane Mwangi was confirmed by the board of NOCK, as the substantive CEO and Managing Director, for a three-year term effective 1 August 2017, replacing Sumayya Hassan-Athmani, who had resigned in July 2016.{{cite web| url=http://www.businessdailyafrica.com/corporate/companies/National-Oil-MaryJane-Mwangi-CEO/4003102-4044866-12o7lgz/index.html | last=Herbling | title=Confirmation of National Oil boss could stoke conflict of interest debate |accessdate=3 November 2017 | date=4 August 2017 |location=Nairobi |first=David |newspaper=[[Business Daily Africa]] |publisher=[[Nation Media Group]]}} ==Other considerations== In July 2016, in her capacity as Acting CEO, she jointed the [[board of directors]] of NOCK, and has been a member since.{{cite web| url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=256872740&privcapId=35929664&previousCapId=35929664&previousTitle=National%20Oil%20Corporation%20of%20Kenya%20Limited | title=Executive Profile of Mary Jane Mwangi, CEO & Director, National Oil Corporation of Kenya Limited | accessdate=3 November 2017 |date=3 November 2017 |last=Bloomberg | publisher=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg Research]]}} ==Family== MaryJane Mangi is married to Martin Mbogo, the Manager of Tullow Oil Kenya. ==See also== * [[Rebecca Miano]] * [[Josephine Wapakhabulo]] * [[Energy in Kenya]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://nationaloil.co.ke/ Website of the National Oil Corporation of Kenya] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mwangi, MaryJane}} [[Category:Year of
